newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit slithers to easier close in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit slithers to easier close in quiet trade.

text.p: The ringgit ended on an easier note against the dollar in quiet trading, dealers said.
The subdued tone of the dollar/majors in Asia slowed speculative interest in the ringgit, with minor corporate orders done, they said.
"The big dollar was quiet, so the ringgit didn't have room to move much," said a local bank dealer.
The dollar was immobilised ahead of the 1230 GMT release of U.S. August international trade data.
At the 1000 GMT local close, ringgit was at 2.5065/75 per dollar against 2.5057/67 on Thursday.
Dealers said the dollar should remain supported by uncertainties in Russia after President Boris Yeltsin sacked security chief Alexander Lebed on Thursday.
In the Kuala Lumpur interbank market, the overnight rate jumped to 8.70 percent from 6.0/10 on a squeeze for funds after Bank Negara's intervention.
The central bank borrowed for a one-month deposit at 7.05 percent, unchanged from its previous intervention level on Oct 4.
